summary: This is a 2020 email chain between attorneys discussing the inability to locate the first volume of a 2009 deposition transcript from a case involving Jeffrey Epstein. The emails reference detailed notes taken by a paralegal/investigator who attended the deposition, which describe the victim's susceptibility to Epstein's pattern of recruitment and grooming.

events.title: Deposition of Victim vs. Epstein
events.description: A deposition was taken in a case involving Jeffrey Epstein. The first volume of the transcript from this date is missing.

events.title: Court Reporter Unable to Locate Deposition
events.description: Toni from Prose Court Reporting confirms via email that a search of records and archives failed to locate Volume I of the 2009 deposition.

events.title: Email Chain Regarding Missing Deposition
events.description: A series of emails between legal professionals discusses the inability to locate the 2009 deposition transcript and references detailed contemporaneous notes from the deposition.

keyFacts: The first volume of a deposition transcript from December 4, 2009, in a case involving Jeffrey Epstein, could not be located by the court reporting service in 2020.

Detailed contemporaneous notes taken by a paralegal/investigator who attended the 2009 deposition were referenced; these notes reportedly describe the victim as a 'troubled young woman' susceptible to Epstein's pattern of recruitment, grooming, and victimization.
The email chain originates from the law firm Searcy Denney Scarola Barnhart & Shipley, P.A., indicating ongoing legal work related to Epstein years after the 2009 event.
A video of the deposition was also confirmed to be no longer available by the videography service, Visual Evidence.
